definitions.definition: a liquid food made by boiling meat, vegetables, etc. in water, often eaten as the first course of a meal
definitions.labels: (British English)(North American English)(British English)(North American English)

examples.text: He ladled out three bowls of soup.
Warhol's paintings of Campbell's soup cans
We had a cold cucumber soup as a starter.
the Chinese delicacy of shark fin soup
the emergence of life from the primordial soup on the earth
I was too sick to eat my soup.
She told me the whole story from soup to nuts.
We're all in the soup now.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French soupe ‘sop, broth (poured on slices of bread)’, from late Latin suppa, of Germanic origin.
